choices.C: Filter uniform resource locator (URL) sites by category.
choices.B: Forward advanced file types from the firewall for analysis.
choices.A: Enforce policy based on Host Information Profile (HIP).
choices.E: Use the WildFire Application Programming Interface (API) to submit website links for analysis.

questions.question_text: A WildFire subscription is required for which two of the following activities? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
BE Correct

No WF: PE files forwared for analysis
WF: Advanced file type forwarding. Upload files using WF API

A and B are correct!

A & B is the answer

questions.question_text: Which two actions should be taken to provide some protection when a client chooses not to block uncategorized websites? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Attach a file-blocking profile to Security policy rules that allow uncategorized websites.
choices.C: Add a Security policy rule using only known URL categories with the action set to "Allow."
choices.D: Attach a data-filtering profile with a custom data pattern to Security policy rules that deny uncategorized websites.
choices.A: Add a URL-filtering profile with the action set to "Continue" for unknown URL categories attached to Security policy rules that allow web access.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
That's the idea of single pass software inspection

Selected Answer: D
https://knowledgebase.paloaltonetworks.com/KCSArticleDetail?id=kA10g000000ClWFCA0
the single pass software in our next-generation firewalls scans content once and in a stream-based fashion to avoid latency introduction

Selected Answer: D
it's D - "stream-based content inspection" https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/resources/whitepapers/single-pass-parallel-processing-architecture

choices.C: It is sent through the slow path for further inspection. If subject to content inspection, it will pass through a single stream-based content inspection engines before egress.
choices.D: It is sent through the fast path because session establishment is not required. If subject to content inspection, it will pass through a single stream-based content inspection engine before egress.
choices.A: It is sent through the fast path because session establishment is not required. If subject to content inspection, it will pass through multiple content inspection engines before egress.
choices.B: It is sent through the slow path for further inspection. If subject to content inspection, it will pass through multiple content inspection engines before egress.

questions.question_text:
A packet that is already associated with a current session arrives at the firewall.
What is the flow of the packet after the firewall determines that it is matched with an existing session?

A customer with a fully licensed Palo Alto Networks firewall is concerned about threats based on domain generation algorithms (DGAs).
Which Security profile is used to configure Domain Name Security (DNS) to identify and block previously unknown DGA-based threats in real time?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The question asks about configuring DNS Security to identify and block DGA-based threats. DNS Security is a feature of the URL Filtering profile, so the correct answer is B.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct 

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/9-1/pan-os-admin/threat-prevention/dns-security/domain-generation-algorithm-detection

BD Correct
